setting.name: Default View
setting.description: The default view used in the MediaPortal GUI when the plug-in is first opened. Valid options are "list", "thumbs", "largethumbs", and "filmstrip".

setting.name: Click Shows Details
setting.description: Determines behavior when a movie in the movie browser is clicked. If true, the details view appears. If false the movie starts playback.

setting.name: Thread Count
setting.description: The number of threads retrieving move details for local media. A higher number uses more system resources, but can help with slow data providers. Do not set this value higher than 10 threads.

setting.name: Use Folders For Matching
setting.description: Enable this setting if each movie has it's own folder.

setting.name: Only Show Results From Same Year
setting.description: If a year keyword is detected and no exact match is found only show the results from the same year or blank year. (experimental)

setting.name: Regular Expression Filter
setting.description: A regular expression that removes common used keywords from the folder/filename.

setting.name: Cover Artwork Folder
setting.description: The folder in which cover art should be saved to disk.

setting.name: Cover Artwork Thumbnails Folder
setting.description: The folder in which cover art thumbnails should be saved to disk.

setting.name: Redownload Coverart on Rescan
setting.description: When a full rescan is performed this setting determines if coverart that has already been downloaded will be reretrieved and the local copy updated.

setting.name: Max Covers per Movie
setting.description: When the movie importer automatically downloads cover art, it will not retrieve more than the given number of covers for a movie.

setting.name: Max Covers per Movie per Session
setting.description: When the movie importer automatically downloads cover art it will not retrieve more than the given number of covers for a movie in a single update / import session. Next time a full update is done, if there are additional covers to download, it will grab those as well.

setting.name: Minimum Cover Width
setting.description: The minimum width in pixels for any given cover. If a cover from any data provider is smaller than this value it will not be downloaded and saved.

setting.name: Minimum Cover Height
setting.description: The minimum height in pixels for any given cover. If a cover from any data provider is smaller than this value it will not be downloaded and saved.

setting.name: Backdrop Folder
setting.description: The folder in which movie backdrops should be saved to disk.

setting.name: Backdrop Thumbnails Folder
setting.description: The folder in which movie backdrop thumbnails should be saved to disk.

setting.name: Redownload Backdrop on Rescan
setting.description: When a full rescan is performed this setting determines if backdrops that have already been downloaded will be reretrieved and the local copy updated.

setting.name: Minimum Backdrop Width
setting.description: The minimum width in pixels for any given movie backdrop. If a backdrop from any data provider is smaller than this value it will not automatically be downloaded and saved.

setting.name: Minimum Backdrop Height
setting.description: The minimum height in pixels for any given movie backdrop. If a cover from any data provider is smaller than this value it will not automatically be downloaded and saved.

setting.name: Max Timeouts
setting.description: The maximum number of timeouts received from the server before a thread returns an error condition.

setting.name: Timeout Length
setting.description: The base length of time (in milliseconds) for a timeout when connecting to the Movie-XML.com data service.

setting.name: Timeout Increment
setting.description: The amount of time (in milliseconds) added to the timeout limit after each timeout failure. A non-zero value will help when the server is experience a large amount of congestion.

setting.name: Timeout Length
setting.description: The base length of time (in milliseconds) for a timeout when connecting to the Movie-XML.com data service.

setting.name: Timeout Increment
setting.description: The amount of time (in milliseconds) added to the timeout limit after each timeout failure. A non-zero value will help when the server is experience a large amount of congestion.

setting.name: Backdrop Filename Pattern
setting.description: The importer will look in your backdrop folder and try to find a file that matches this pattern. If one is found, it will be used as a backdrop. If none is found, an online data provider will be used to auto download artwork.
